intro: Holophyllum lanuginosum, commonly known as the woolly holophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its hairy, or lanuginous, stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in the spring. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a leathery texture, while its roots are often used in traditional medicine. Holophyllum lanuginosum thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments.
